column2: Callaway Digital Technologies is looking for Cloud and Linux Adminsitrator to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A C++ Linux developer is a software developer who specializes in writing C++ code specifically for Linux-based operating systems      They design, develop, test, and maintain software applications, libraries, and systems that run on Linux platforms      These developers are proficient in C++ programming language and have a deep understanding of Linux operating system internals      The responsibilities of a C++ Linux developer may include:Software Development: Writing efficient, clean, and modular C++ code for Linux-based applications and systems      This involves designing software architecture, implementing algorithms and data structures, and ensuring code quality through proper testing and debugging      Linux System Programming: Developing system-level software components that interact with the Linux operating system kernel and low-level system APIs      This may include working with system calls, file I/O, process management, memory management, and inter-process communication (IPC)      Linux Toolchain and Build Systems: Utilizing Linux toolchain and build systems, such as GNU Make, CMake, or Autotools, to compile, build, and package software applications      This involves configuring build scripts, managing dependencies, and ensuring compatibility across different Linux distributions      Performance Optimization: Analyzing and optimizing the performance of C++ code on Linux systems      This may involve profiling applications, identifying bottlenecks, and implementing performance improvements, such as algorithm optimizations or memory management techniques      Linux API Integration: Integrating with Linux-specific APIs and libraries to leverage system functionalities and services      This includes working with networking libraries, file system APIs, inter-process communication mechanisms (eg, sockets, pipes), or multimedia frameworks on Linux      Linux Kernel Modules and Device Drivers: Developing kernel modules or device drivers in C++ to interface with hardware devices or extend the functionality of the Linux kernel      This requires knowledge of Linux kernel internals, device driver frameworks, and kernel debugging techniques      Cross-Platform Development: Adapting C++ code to ensure compatibility and portability across different Linux distributions and platforms      This involves writing platform-independent code and addressing any platform-specific differences or dependencies      Version Control and Collaboration: Using version control systems like Git to manage source code, collaborate with other developers, and participate in team-based development workflows      Troubleshooting and Debugging: Identifying and resolving software defects, memory leaks, and other issues using debugging tools, profilers, and logging mechanisms available on Linux platforms
column11: algorithms, c, software development, kernel, linux system programming, device drivers, operating systems, networking, gnu, cloud administration, multimedia, system, git, linux, cmake, debugging, data structures, sockets, performance optimization, ipc, programming

column2: As an AWS DevOps Automation Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and maintaining automated solutions for continuous integration, deployment, and infrastructure management      This role involves working with development and operations teams to streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and ensure the reliability of applications hosted on the AWS platform        Responsibilities:        Infrastructure as Code (IaC):Implement and manage Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation      Define, version, and automate the provisioning of infrastructure components      Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD):Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines for applications hosted on AWS      Integrate automated testing and deployment processes into the CI/CD pipelines      Automation Scripts:Develop automation scripts using languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell to automate routine tasks and deployment processes      Automate manual processes to increase efficiency and reduce errors      AWS Services Integration:Integrate and configure various AWS services to support CI/CD, such as AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CodeDeploy      Leverage AWS Lambda for serverless automation tasks      Configuration Management:Implement configuration management tools (eg, Ansible, Chef, Puppet) to automate the setup and configuration of infrastructure components      Ensure consistency and repeatability in server configurations      Monitoring and Logging:Implement monitoring solutions to track the health and performance of AWS resources      Configure logging and monitoring tools to detect and respond to issues proactively      Security Automation:Implement security automation practices to ensure compliance with security policies and standards      Automate security checks and vulnerability assessments in the CI/CD pipelines      Collaboration:Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to understand requirements and implement automation solutions      Participate in Agile/DevOps practices, including stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives      Documentation:Maintain comprehensive documentation for automation processes, scripts, and configurations      Create documentation for troubleshooting and issue resolution      Continuous Learning:Stay updated on AWS services, DevOps best practices, and emerging technologies      Seek opportunities for professional development and training

Develop, maintain, and optimize software build scripts, build agents, and other CI and CD automations.        You will be key in disaster recovery planning and execution      You ll work together with all teams to ship our code to production using Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) and AppSec tooling. column2: Internship description IT Real Time Project based DevOps Internship (Along with real time sessions on Angular, React - J.S) The demand for IT trained professionals on real time projects is exponentially increasing Kani is offering you a limited period opportunity to get trained on real-time projects in an excellent corporate working environment. Internship platform is open for graduates ,post graduates from Engineering, Commerce , Management, and other backgrounds. We are here to help bridge the gap between a students classroom environment and their workplace atmosphere. We provide hands-on experience on our real-time projects to expose the IT aspirants on the real-world challenges and industry standards of implementing a IT project. Kani offers IT Real Time Project based internships to any graduate who completed graduation in 2021 or academic years prior to 2021. Admission is strictly interview based and good communication skills is a prerequisite. DevOps Internship With Sessions on Angular, React -J.S) Class room based training by real time MNC experienced trainers Live/Real Time Projects . Candidates should have basic Coding skills. column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to lead the engagement effort of providing high-quality and value-adding consulting solutions to customers at different stages- from problem definition to diagnosis to solution design, development and deployment.  You will review the proposals prepared by consultants, provide guidance, and analyze the solutions defined for the client business problems to identify any potential risks and issues.  You will identify change Management requirements and propose a structured approach to client for managing the change using multiple communication mechanisms.  You will also coach and create a vision for the team, provide subject matter training for your focus areas, motivate and inspire team members through effective and timely feedback and recognition for high performance.  You would be a key contributor in unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high-quality, value-adding consulting solutions to customers adhering to the guidelines and processes of the organization. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: Primary skill: AWS Cloud  Preferred Skills: AWS DevOps  Cloud->AWS Administration(AWS IAAS)  Educational Requirements Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Cloud & Infrastructure Services *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements  CLICK TO PROCEED

column2: The Senior Manager Global CSQA (LCCI) is responsible for daily operations within their assigned team of CSQA Reps at LCCI     This role supports the LCCI TechLilly account and CSQA team locally at LCCI     As such they will support projects and activities across multiple IT functions collaborating with the more functionally aligned CSQA Associate Directors     This role includes strong capacity and personnel management, staff development, project and business planning/management, and cross-functional communication     The Senior Manager collaborates closely with other members of the Global Information Systems Quality (GISQ) Lead Team to provide strategic input and ensure alignment with GISQ objectives     Additionally, they ensure that supported computer systems comply with corporate computer system validation standards and practices         Key Objectives/Deliverables:                    ?       Personnel Management         Recruit for and staff positions to meet business needs while leveraging diverse global talent.     Supervise direct reports and facilitate performance management, personnel development, and career development through coaching and transparent feedback; escalate issues to upper management as appropriate.     Create a culture of accountability, excellence, integrity, and inclusion.     Appropriately identify and resolve personnel issues in collaboration with human resources and functional management.     Participate and represent staff in succession planning activities, talent assessment, annual compensation review, promotion processes, and reward and recognition activities to retain and motivate staff.     Ensure development, implementation, and compliance of training for team personnel.     Partner with LCCI Human Resources         Maintain Inspection Readiness         Ensure systems within the assigned portfolio of quality oversight are kept continually inspection ready.     Manage resources to effectively provide oversight of supported areas and ensure quality issues are properly documented and tracked with appropriate Quality/CAPA plans and are escalated appropriately.     Understand outputs from self-inspections, audits, and vendor evaluation activity and their impact on compliance health and priorities.     Provide periodic updates to key functional management and stakeholders as appropriate.             Streamline and Continuously Improve         Drive strategy and direction as key member of GISQ Leadership team.     Oversee and/or sponsor streamlining and simplification initiatives both within GISQ team as well as those that impact business partner areas.     Improve internal processes and influence process improvements.             Deliver Projects, Programs, and Support         Ensure delivery of CSQA services to business partner areas.     Understand business partner, company, and Quality priorities.     Connect business partners with answers on matters related to Corporate Computer Systems standards and practices.     Approve key deliverables to ensure compliance.     Establish and nurture account management relationships with TechLilly partners to ensure alignment on priorities, quality concerns, risks, and operational needs.     Ensure CSQA team members provide risk-based guidance, hold the line on compliance, and maintain oversight of compliance through separation of duties with TechLilly.         Minimum Requirements:         University degree in a technology-related field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Life Sciences; or equivalent experience (ie, 3+ years experience in Automation/IT or computer system validation)     Minimum 3 yearsexperience directly leading people.     Demonstrated strong oral and written communication and interpersonal interaction skills.     Solid understanding of IT systems development life cycle     Experience with computer systems validation, including application of external GxP regulatory expectations.             Additional Preferences:         Previous experience with Computer Systems Validation, including support of systems and/or programs.     Previous experience in GMP, GLP, GCP environment.     Understanding of process development and/or improvement (eg Six Sigma).     Technical knowledge of IT system development lifecycle.     Knowledge of Lilly business as it relates to impact to products and patients.     Familiarity with IT Best Practices (eg, LSEF, ITIL)

column1: DevOps / Arch Support / ETL / Data Pipelines Developer
column2: We are currently seeking a talented and ambitious DevOps and Architecture Support Engineer with 2-5 years of experience, specializing in ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and data pipelines     In this role, you will contribute to the optimization of our data workflows, support ETL processes, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the overall system architecture             Responsibilities:        ?       DevOps and Infrastructure:         Assist in the implementation and maintenance of CI/CD pipelines for ETL processes.      Support development teams in automating and streamlining deployment processes.      Participate in the management and optimization of cloud infrastructure.          ETL Development and Maintenance:         Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.      Collaborate on troubleshooting and optimizing existing ETL processes for performance and efficiency.          Data Pipeline Management:         Support the building and management of data pipelines for efficient and reliable data flow between systems.      Collaborate with data engineers on the implementation of scalable and maintainable data architectures.          Monitoring and Support:         Assist in the implementation of monitoring solutions to ensure the health and performance of data pipelines and ETL processes.      Provide support for production issues, conduct root cause analysis, and contribute to corrective actions.          Collaboration:         Work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and contribute to data availability and quality.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data solutions into the overall system architecture.          Documentation:         Contribute to the maintenance of comprehensive documentation for ETL processes, data pipelines, and infrastructure configurations.          Security:         Assist in the implementation and enforcement of security best practices for data handling and storage.          Qualifications:          Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.      2-5 years of hands-on experience in DevOps roles, including exposure to CI/CD implementation and cloud infrastructure management.      Familiarity with designing, developing, and maintaining ETL processes.      Exposure to data pipeline orchestration tools (eg, Apache NiFi, Apache Airflow).      Proficiency in scripting languages (eg, Python, Bash) for automation tasks.      Basic understanding of database systems (SQL and NoSQL) and data warehousing concepts.      Familiarity with version control systems (eg, Git) and infrastructure as code (IaC) principles.      Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.      Good communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team.      Awareness of security protocols and best practices in data handling.          Education:          UG: BCA in Any Specialization, B.Tech/B.E. in Any Specialization, B.Sc in Any Specialization      PG: Any Postgraduate          Skills:          Azure DevOps, Ansible, PowerShell, .Net, C# etc

column2: The      AWS Developer      position is a highly technical role. We need someone that can dive deep and build complex, AWS-optimized architectures. This person should be enthusiastic while also being technically proficient with cloud infrastructure of web applications.            The      AWS Developer      is expected to understand the core      AWS services     and apply best practices regarding security and scalability.      If you love learning and implementing new technology, with a passion for writing code, we d love to talk to you!         Responsibilities:           Ensure customer success in building and launching Amazon Connect solutions for NeuraFlash customers         Facilitate business process reviews to identify customer requirements and processes         Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud          Translate customer requirements into contact center design, leveraging best practices and minimizing the need for custom development         Configure Salesforce Service Cloud Voice and Amazon Connect solutions         Act as the technical liaison between customers, partners, and support         Drive best practices for contact center design in every aspect of solution          Manage all technical aspects of projects and necessary customer communications         Deliver customer end-user training and documentation         Exercise independent judgment, and take the lead role on enterprise level projects with minimal direction from senior management         Lead vision and strategy discussions with contact center and customer service leadership and management           Required Skills           Customer-facing contact center experience         Communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and customers         API integration experience         Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills         Experience deploying AWS resources using infrastructure as code (Cloudformation, CDK, Terraform, etc.)          Comfortable writing Lambda functions in javascript or python         Experience creating bots in Lex, ideally with custom Lambda integrations           Nice to haves           Contact Center architecture knowledge         Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or consulting         Hands on experience building complex omnichannel contact center solutions         Advanced knowledge of AWS services and cloud architecture         Familiarity with Salesforce Service Cloud         Contact center product knowledge of other platforms (Genesys, Cisco, Avaya, Twilio, etc.)         Salesforce knowledge         Experience working with outbound dialers, campaign management         Experience with WorkForce Management solutions         Experience building integrations across WFM, CRM and contact center solutions         Experience with communications protocols and APIs such as WebRTC and SIP         Experience designing call flows, preferably with Amazon Connect         Customer-facing contact center experience with Amazon Connect           Certifications -      One or more of the following:           AWS Cloud Practitioner Certification         AWS Developer Associate Certification or Professional         AWS Solution Architect Certification or Professional         Salesforce Certified Administrator          What s it like to be a part of NeuraFlash      Remote In-Person: Whether you work out of our HQ in Massachusetts, one of our regional hubs, our India office, or youre one of over half of our NeuraFlash Family who work remotely, we re focused on keeping everyone connected and unified as one team.     Travel: Get ready to pack your bags and hit the road! For certain roles, travel is an exciting part of the job, with an anticipated travel commitment of up to 25%. So, if you have a passion for adventure and dont mind a little jet-setting, this opportunity could be your ticket to exploring new places while making a positive impact on clients.     Flexibility: Do you have to take the dog to the vet, pick up the kids from school, or the in-laws from the airportWe know that a perfect 9-5 isn t possible. So you have to jump out to do any of those, no problem! We build a culture of trust and understanding. We value good work not the hours in which you get it done     Collaboration: You have a voice here! If you work with a team of smart people like we do, it s a no-brainer to take suggestions and feedback on how to keep NeuraFlash thriving. Our executive team holds town halls company meetings where they address any suggestions or questions asked, no matter how big or small.     Celebrate Often: We take our work seriously, but we don t take ourselves too seriously. Whether it is an arm wrestling contest, costume party, or ugly holiday sweaters our teams love to have fun. And while we work hard, we don t forget to slow down and celebrate the big things and the small things together.         Be in the right space: Work at the forefront of AI Innovation on the Salesforce Platform.     Growth: In 2021, we grew our team by close to 90%, and we plan to do the same again this year! There s no limit to where your career at NeuraFlash can go.                                 LD Program: We are invested in your success. This program was built to help our employees advance in their career in Salesforce and at NeuraFlash.     Mentorship Program: Each new team member is assigned a mentor to help them acclimate at NeuraFlash.     Monthly Weekly Socials: We hold monthly weekly virtual socials to have more opportunities to be together.     Company Retreats: This looks a little different in the age of COVID-19 but we gather the entire company twice a year to share stories visions for NeuraFlash.

HPCaaS, you will be responsible for establishing and executing strategic objectives focused on improving the effective utilization of the compute resources while meeting or exceeding customer service level agreements for job prioritization, job concurrency, and job throughput in our EDA compute clusters     This includes leading architectural innovation and path finding efforts to create and implement Western Digital s next generation Grid computing environment     As a member of the team, you will be expected to not only deliver on technical requirements and solutions but also be able to present your solutions to senior management     Responsibilities include but are not limited to working as an individual contributor, a team member and a technical team lead to explore, define, and pilot new solutions with little supervision     Develop solutions, scripts, and/or processes to automate management of services and tools as required     In this role, you will be collaborating closely with EDA and hardware design team stakeholders to define and deliver workload efficiency improvements in Western Digital s EDA HPC infrastructure globally         What you'll be doing:         Support multi-site, high-performance compute infrastructure and services for the global engineering product development organizations     Design, create, deliver, and support the deployment of Ansible automation within HPC and Unix environments     Identify and propose solutions and new services for the distributed ASIC and GPU computing clusters     Perform troubleshooting and root cause analysis of HPC clusters and file system related issues     Develop and maintain documentation for all aspects of the HPC infrastructure     Improve root cause analysis and corrective action for problems large and small - column2: The successful candidate is an expert in Development Operations (DevOps) engineering       An "automate everything" attitude is needed and desired     Strong application support, debugging, and incident support skills are required to be successful in the role     Strong cloud infrastructure and system administration management experience is expected     The position requires working with teams to identify and repair issues on an as-needed basis     You will need strong communication skills to be effective     A proactive demeanor and friendly disposition are essential for success          CloudOps Engineer:                 Must have in-depth knowledge of concepts within job function as would normally be obtained in 3-4 years.          Must possess strong knowledge of cloud technology.          Strong understanding of each service across the full IT lifecycle and be ready to take requests for infrastructure services, applications, and environments.         Experience designing solutions (Monitoring / process orchestration / capacity management / deployment) that can scale and potentially be leveraged by other parts of the organization.          Hands on experience working in both Agile and DevOps development methodologies.         Requires strong communication and presentation skills to explain and resolve complex technical issues to technical and non-technical audiences.          Requires ability to communicate and interact across facilities and at various levels.          Be able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, analyze and prioritize workload effectively, participate in ad-hoc meetings for problem-solving, and thrive in a dynamic environment.         As is typical in this industry, variable shifts and hours and carrying/responding to a pager may be required.          ?     WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING        Cloud Infrastructure Management:     Manage and maintain cloud infrastructure on platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.     Monitor cloud resources to ensure availability and scalability.     Troubleshoot cloud-related infrastructure incidents and issues.     Perform customer deployments, migrations, and upgrades in the cloud environment.     Building and maintaining highly available systems for SaaS products     Improve cloud product reliability, availability, maintainability, and cost/benefit-including developing fault-tolerant tools to ensure general robustness of the cloud infrastructure. Exposure  to data unification techniques and tools like Tamr is highly desirable.

column2: Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD):    Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment processes, enabling frequent and reliable releases utilizing the Codefresh CI/CD platform.        Infrastructure as Code (IaC):    Utilize tools such as Terraform and Ansible to define and manage infrastructure resources programmatically, ensuring consistency and reproducibility across environments.        Containerization and Orchestration:    Implement containerization using AWS EKS and orchestrate containerized applications with Kubernetes to achieve scalability, resilience, and portability.        Monitoring and Logging:    Set up monitoring and logging solutions (e.g., Prometheus, etc.) to enable tracking system performance, identification of issues, and assist engineering teams proactively troubleshooting potential problems.        Automation and Scripting:    Develop scripts and automation workflows using scripting languages like Python & Bash to automate repetitive tasks and improve operational efficiency.        Configuration Management:    Manage configuration drift and enforce desired state configurations using tools like Ansible, ensuring consistency and compliance across servers.        Collaboration and Communication:    Work closely with development, QA, and operations teams to promote a DevOps culture, facilitate knowledge sharing, and drive collaboration towards common goals.        Security and Compliance:    Implement security best practices and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR) throughout the software delivery pipeline, ensuring data protection and regulatory compliance. column2: To effectively lead DevOps initiatives in the B2B SaaS sector within the US healthcare industry.      We need strong expertise in Devops with 8+years of experience.            Understand Healthcare Compliance    : Prioritize understanding the regulatory landscape, especially HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) regulations, as they heavily govern data handling and security within the US healthcare industry.        Assessment and Planning    : Conduct a thorough assessment of the current infrastructure, development processes, and deployment pipelines. Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.        Implement Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)    : Establish robust CI/CD pipelines to automate the build, test, and deployment processes. Ensure that these pipelines adhere to compliance requirements, especially regarding data privacy and security.        Infrastructure as Code (IaC)    : Utilize tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation to manage infrastructure as code. This approach ensures consistency, scalability, and easier management of infrastructure components.        Containerization and Orchestration    : Implement Docker for containerization and Kubernetes for orchestration. Containerization enables consistent deployment across different environments, while Kubernetes automates deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.        Monitoring and Logging    : Set up comprehensive monitoring and logging solutions to track system performance, detect issues proactively, and ensure compliance with service-level agreements (SLAs) and regulatory requirements.        Security Automation    : Implement automated security testing throughout the development lifecycle. Utilize tools like OWASP ZAP for security scanning and integrate security checks into the CI/CD pipeline.        Collaboration and Communication    : Foster a culture of collaboration between development, operations, and security teams. Utilize collaboration tools like Slack, Jira, or Microsoft Teams to facilitate communication and streamline workflows.        Training and Skill Development    : Invest in training and skill development programs to ensure that team members stay updated with the latest technologies and best practices in DevOps and healthcare compliance.        Compliance and Risk Management    : Regularly conduct compliance audits and risk assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities and ensure adherence to regulatory requirements. Implement policies and procedures to mitigate risks effectively.        Vendor Management    : If using third-party services or APIs, ensure that vendors comply with healthcare regulations and have robust security measures in place. Regularly assess vendor performance and security practices.        Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Planning    : Develop and test disaster recovery and business continuity plans to ensure minimal disruption in case of system failures or security breaches.        Performance Optimization    : Continuously monitor system performance and optimize infrastructure and application components for efficiency and scalability.        Feedback and Iteration    : Encourage feedback from stakeholders, including customers and internal teams, and use it to iterate and improve DevOps processes continuously.                  Requirements:          Bachelors or masters degree with highly qualified multidisciplinary, incredibly talented professionals from highly renowned and accredited medical schools, business schools, and engineering institutes.      8+ years of proven experience as a DevOps Engineer with a focus on AWS.      Expertise in AWS services, including but not limited to EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and others.      In-depth knowledge of CI/CD tools (eg, Jenkins, AWS Code Pipeline), containerization (Docker), and orchestration (AWS ECS, Kubernetes).      Strong scripting skills (eg, Python, Bash) and experience with Infrastructure as Code.      Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor team members.      Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.      AWS certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Solutions Architect are a plus.                HiLabs Total Rewards            Competitive Salary, Accelerated Incentive Policies, H1B sponsorship, Comprehensive benefits package that includes ESOPs, financial contribution for your ongoing professional and personal development, medical coverage for you and your loved ones, 401k, PTOs a collaborative working environment, Smart mentorship, and highly qualified multidisciplinary, incredibly talented professionals from highly renowned and accredited medical schools, business schools, and engineering institutes.

column2: Note   : We are looking for candidates who can work from Pune location and work from   office mode of working.  Request   you to apply with below link   https://careersind-avalara.icims.com/jobs/12780/security-automation-lead/job?mode=view&mobile=false&width=741&height=500&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=330&jun1offset=330 JOB DESCRIPTION What Youll Do   Join us in building a secure platform supporting Avalara's expanding business. In  this role you will have the opportunity to engage with the best and brightest  engineers and architects as they build our future application and service capabilities, while ensuring our current generation solutions continue to deliver the trust and reliability our customers expect.  If you want to make a big difference in a fast-moving environment without endless meetings, if you want to set your direction instead of having it set for you, if you want to have all the benefits of start-up and an established company, then this is the job for you.   Our ideal Security Automation Lead has experience working on a variety of platforms and technologies and is passionate about automating tedious security processes to simplify them. Automation is fundamental to modern agile security organizations, and you will be responsible for making the security tools and processes and the underlying infrastructure valuable and consistent.  You will strive toward    Infrastructure-as-Code and Policy-as-Code to make our systems as reliable and maintainable as possible. You will provide guidance, training, and support to the rest of the Security Engineering team as they contribute additional tools to the security program.   You will be able to talk about technology and business. You will work tirelessly to find the right solution, not the first solution. You thrive on challenge, and you are not afraid to dig in, all while having fun and not getting too serious.  Job Duties Creating and managing a security automation framework.  Maintaining and improving the infrastructure that security relies upon.  Evangelizing and assisting the security engineering teams with tool integrations across the organization.  Providing training and guidance to security engineering to integrate new tools into the security pipeline.  What You'll Need to be Successful 4+ years' of software development experience, preferring in Go/Python  Ability to build custom solutions using APIs  Experience working with terraform IaC.  Good knowledge of CICD preferably using Gitlab.  Experience on at-least 2 cloud providers(AWS, GCP, Azure and OCI)  Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field  Experience in docker and Kubernetes

column2: LEAD DEVOPS ENGINEER Pune, Maharashtra, India Overview: Guidepoints Engineering team thrives on problem-solving and creating happier users. As Guidepoint works to achieve its mission of making individuals, businesses, and the world smarter through personalized knowledge-sharing solutions, the engineering team is taking on challenges to improve our internal CRM system and create new products to optimize the seamless delivery of our services. As a Lead  of DevOps & Cloud Engineering, you will be a core member of the engineering leadership team. In this role, you will manage and lead a team of Sys. Admin and DevOps engineers. You will be responsible for developing and executing a Development Operations (DevOps) strategy to ensure quality software deployments and overall application health and performance?   What Youll Do:   Complete ownership of CI/CD, DevSecOps, and Site reliability engineering supporting Enterprise Production, Development, and Test workloads. Manage Kubernetes cluster and Helm Charts Lead and manage a team of experienced System Administrators and DevOps engineers in our global team. Provision, install, configure, optimize, maintain, and support all components of the Web Applications Stack: (Linux, Apache, SQL, PHP, Solr, Elastic Search, Redis, Couchbase) Automate governance functions using Pipelines for MS teams/slack for approvals. Automate DevSecOps pipelines and ensure DevSecOps best practices are being adhered. Work closely with the InfoSec team to ensure adherence to Guidepoints security standards. Efficiently use cloudOps services to gain operational efficiency. Work closely with App Ops, Engineering, and CloudOps teams to resolve complex problems. Ensure availability, reliability, Scalability, and performance of Automation for both CI/CD Triage pipeline and act as SME on pipeline issues Effectively prioritize to work on multiple projects simultaneously. Use monitoring, logging, and alerting to develop automated service remediation scripts for proactively managing pipelines. Evaluate new technologies and tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of DevOps processes. Be cost-aware and support cost-reduction initiatives. Align and communicate effectively with stakeholders. Mentor engineers on CI/CD best practices. Contribute to overall engineering initiatives as a member of the engineering leadership team.   What You Have:   8+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer / System Administrator 3+ years of managing teams that run ?DevSecOps (SAST/DAST/IAST/SCA) pipelines and meeting release criteria 3+ Years of managing SRE functions and supporting Service reliability. 3+ years of experience managing a team of System Administrators and Cloud/DevOps Engineers 3+ years of managing and maintaining Kubernetes clusters and Helm Charts Hands-on experience and knowledge of Linux (CentOs), PHP (configs/modules), Apache, Nginx, Solr, Elastic Search Clusters, Redis, Couchbase, SQL Server, and RabbitMQ. Well-versed in git version control.

column2: About the role As an Azure DevOps Specialist at BABB, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our cloud infrastructure on Microsoft Azure. You will collaborate closely with our internal team to ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of our cloud-based applications and services. In addition to your expertise in Azure DevOps tools and practices, you will also possess a strong understanding of networking aspects of Azure services, PaaS, SaaS, Azure Pipelines YAML CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Bicep, and experience with Azure networking services like VNet, NSG, etc. Sounds like you? Let's talk! Role & responsibilities   Design, implement, and manage cloud infrastructure solutions on Microsoft Azure. Develop and maintain Azure Pipelines YAML configurations for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. Collaborate with internal team to automate build, test, and deployment processes. Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Bicep to automate the provisioning and management of Azure resources. Monitor and optimize the performance, reliability, and scalability of Azure services. Implement and maintain networking configurations for Azure services, ensuring security and compliance requirements are met. Provide technical guidance and support to internal team. Stay up-to-date with the latest Azure technologies, tools, and best practices. Preferred candidate qualification   GIT - we follow everything as a code approach Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. 3+ years of experience in a similar role, with a focus on Microsoft Azure. Proficiency in Azure DevOps tools and practices, including Azure Pipelines YAML CI/CD. Strong understanding of networking aspects of Azure services, including Virtual Networks (VNets), Network Security Groups (NSGs), and other Azure networking services. Strong understanding of Azure services with virtual network integration for network isolation Microsoft Azure certifications, such as Azure Administrator Associate or Azure DevOps Engineer Expert. Azure App Services vnet integration, private links Experience with Azure DevOps Pipelines YAML configurations. Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Bicep. Knowledge of cloud security best practices and compliance standards. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Bicep or similar tools. Familiarity with cloud security best practices and compliance standards. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Perks and benefits   Up to 2 days of remote work. Performance based bonuses. Our tech stack:   iOS: Swift 5, Xcode 13.2.1. Android: Android SDK, Kotlin and Java. Backend: .NET 7/8, REST API, Azure Functions, PostgreSQL, AngularJS, xUnit. PowerShell Infrastructure as a code: Bicep, Azure Web Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Key Vault, Azure Service Bus, Application Insights, Log Analytics Workspaces. CI/CD: Azure DevOps pipeline as code (YAML)

column2: You have an opportunity to be part of a world-class DevOps engineering team to empower our product and engineering organization to innovate at the speed of business.          You will contribute to developing a DevOps Engineering System through building strong relationship with DevOps enablement team, change management team, Product and Engineering, Global Technology Services, cyber security, education, and professional services organizations.         You will report to the DevOps engineering enablement lead. You will support the enablement lead to build a strategy with a coherent plan, apply modern and resilient DevOps pattern, implement, and continuously improve an end2end DevOps engineering system.         You will work with the engineering lead to define, communicate, enable, and institutionalize the best DevOps practices for product engineering teams through an enterprise-wide engineering system.         You will partner closely with the DevOps enablement SMEs such as Automation SMEs, Quality SMEs, Security SMEs to architect, design and implement One Engineering System, and then guide and help Product and Engineering teams to adopt One Engineering System.         You will also work with Product and Engineering teams to continuously improve the DevOps process through frequent feedback loops.         You will work with the product architecture lead, security lead and global technology services lead to define and adopt the best DevOps tools to enable both FICO pipeline and Platform pipeline.         You will bring engineering disciplines and system thinking into your design and implementation so you can maximize the flow of DevOps value stream.         You need to use data to inform decision making. Analyze data for trends and potential pain points and use this to prioritize and inform how to improve your engineering product.         You need to gather feedback from key stakeholders and provide recommendations on the best way to advance your team s objectives.         You need to act as an agent for change within the organization to build strong teams and advance FICO s platform first agenda.         FICO Platform provides the ideal foundation companies need to marry the power of human expertise and logic with artificial intelligence and advanced analytics to drive smarter, faster, and more profitable business outcomes.         You will be responsible for building the One Engineering System to be used by our product engineering organization that builds the world class FICO platform.         You will contribute to our mission which is to be at the heart of our clients operations, from accelerating digital transformation to breaking down organizational silos to broadening credit access. We bring the power of human expertise and artificial intelligence together, enabling our clients to make real-time decisions that matter, at scale.                 What We re Seeking             An ideal candidate is an out-of-the-box thinker, an effective learner, a result-oriented doer, an empathic helper, and an effective communicator.         A high-potential candidate who has passion for learning and staying up to date with emerging technologies and practices, and excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.         A DevOps or software engineer who has been part of software continuous delivery and has passion to develop automation to continuously create value in the end2end DevOps process.         Ideal candidate possesses the following attributes: Creative Thinker, Agile Mindset, Strong Listener, Development Experience, Hands-on DevOps Experiences, Easily Builds Trusting Relationships, Focused on Continual Improvement, Charismatic, Ability to Learn, and High Level of Emotional Intelligence (EQ).         Ideal candidate leads by example to embrace DevOps culture and mindset including culture of experimentation, collaboration, co-create, continuous improvement, and outcome over output.         Strong understanding of containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.         Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.         Experience working asynchronously in a remote, distributed team. Experience working global teams.         Strong communication skills, with clear verbal communication as well as written communication skills.         A highly empathic DevOps practitioner who can interact with Product and Engineering teams with a growth mindset.         Collaborative style: partners well with cross-functional teams solve hard problems and to complete complex deliverables with quality and business outcome.         Ability to work across organizations with Product management, Product Engineering, Cyber Security, UX, Global Technology Services, Legal, education and professional services.         Experience in software automation, test automation, software development, product engineering, DevOps engineering, or equivalent experience with a proven ability to work in a product and engineering organization.         K8S, AWS, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Java, GitHub, kafka, Open-Source working experience is highly preferred.         Test automation and Application Security (DevSecOps) experience is highly preferred.         ArgoCD and CrossPlane knowledge and experience is highly preferred.         A calm and problem-solving personality when dealing with production issues is highly preferred.         Community experience is preferred. An ideal candidate is someone who can demonstrate collaboration skills, show leadership potential, demonstrate a commitment to personal growth, and shows a commitment to social responsibility.         Bachelor s degree in highly related field; Advanced degree a plus.

You will bring subject matter expertise and focus on continuous integration and deployment pipelines.      Your charter is to collaborate with Engineering, Test, and DevOps to consolidate frameworks and automate as possible from code analysis, build, integration with test automation suites, and ultimately enabling hands-off deployments to global AWS environments.     You will support our cloud SAAS globally as a member of our DevOps team and proactively collaborate with the UK US and Singapore teams to ensure service continuity and security.      The successful candidate will be working on various cutting-edge DevOps tools and technologies (Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, docker, Multi Cloud etc) to manage Cloud-based enterprise applications. They will be expected to help providing breakthrough genomics informatics solutions worldwide enabling the transformation of human health through DNA sequencing.             Responsibilities           Support highly visible & critical live Atlassian services that are built on complex infrastructure. column2: We are seeking an experienced and motivated Azure DevOps Developer to join our dynamic team. As an Azure DevOps Developer, you will play a critical role in building, deploying, and maintaining our cloud-based applications and infrastructure. Your expertise in Azure DevOps tools and practices will help streamline our development processes and ensure the continuous delivery of high-quality software solutions.             Responsibilities:       1. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software developers, system administrators, and QA engineers, to design, implement, and maintain scalable and reliable cloud-based solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform.     2. Develop, configure, and optimize CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps Services, ensuring smooth and efficient automated build, test, and deployment processes.     3. Monitor and maintain the health, performance, and security of Azure infrastructure components, including virtual machines, storage accounts, and networking resources.     4. Implement and manage configuration management processes using tools like ARM templates, PowerShell, or other Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices.     5. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to deployments, build failures, and infrastructure problems, ensuring high availability of our applications.     6. Collaborate with development teams to improve code quality, test coverage, and development workflows by integrating code analysis, automated testing, and code review tools within the CI/CD pipeline.     7. Stay up-to-date with the latest Azure DevOps best practices and technologies, and proactively recommend improvements to existing processes.     8. Participate in architectural discussions and provide valuable insights on designing cloud-native and highly available solutions.     9. Contribute to the documentation of system configurations, architecture, and standard operating procedures.     10. Assist in managing Azure subscriptions, resource groups, access controls, and billing management.     11. Coach and mentor junior members of the team, sharing your knowledge and best practices.             Requirements:       1. Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.     2. Proven work experience as an Azure DevOps Developer or a similar role with at least 5 years of hands-on experience in designing and implementing cloud-based solutions on Microsoft Azure.     3. Strong expertise in Azure DevOps Services (formerly known as Visual Studio Team Services or VSTS), including CI/CD pipeline creation and management, release management, and build automation.     4. column1: Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO) and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
column2: Role & responsibilities   As an Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO) and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Engineer (L3), you will be responsible for providing expert-level technical leadership and expertise in managing and maintaining complex containerized applications on Azure using ARO and AKS. You will work closely with our clients, project managers, and internal teams to design and implement cutting-edge container-based solutions.  Design, deploy, and manage highly available and scalable Azure Red Hat OpenShift (ARO) and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters.  Provide technical leadership and guidance to junior and mid-level engineers.  Work with development teams to design and implement containerized applications and deploy them on ARO and AKS.  Troubleshoot and resolve complex issues related to ARO and AKS clusters.  Monitor and optimize the performance of ARO and AKS clusters.  Ensure the security and compliance of ARO and AKS environments.  Collaborate with other teams to integrate ARO and AKS clusters with other cloud and on- premises systems.  Develop and implement best practices for ARO and AKS cluster management and operations.  Stay updated with the latest ARO, AKS, and containerization technologies and best practices.  Proven experience designing, deploying, and managing ARO and AKS clusters in production environments.  Expert knowledge of containerization concepts and technologies, including Docker and Kubernetes. Experience with Red Hat OpenShift is a plus.  Certifications such as AZ-400, Red Hat Certified Specialist in Containers and Kubernetes, or equivalent are highly desirable. Experience with cloud-native technologies and microservices architecture.

column2: Hello All We are hiring for SME Azure Devops Job Title: Subject Matter Expert Place of work: Mumbai, Gurgaon, Chennai, Bangalore Responsibility section About the role We??e searching for a highly skilled and experienced Cloud DevOps & Automation Expert having experience on IaC, DevOps, DevSecOps, and cloud automation to join our Service Delivery team, which is responsible for Integration, managing, securing, and supporting Cloud & IT infrastructure for our customers around the world. This is a senior-level position that involves managing and supporting the cloud infrastructure for our customer(s). You will be typically involving a high level of technical expertise and experience in cloud-based systems and infrastructure. Primary role will be developing or modifying code to automate tasks or meet business requirements ensure the reliable and efficient operation of cloud infrastructure and services. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the automation and DevOps processes in cloud environment. You will play a crucial role in optimizing development, deployment, and operational workflows, ensuring efficient and reliable infrastructure delivery. You will need to be able to troubleshoot and resolve issues quickly, automate processes, and ensure that the cloud infrastructure is secure and highly available. You would be expected to have a deep understanding of Cloud services, architecture, and deployment methodologies, as well as a strong grasp of DevOps best practices. You will be required to work in 24x7 support environment to ensure service availability to our customers cloud and IT infrastructure. Job Responsibilities: ??Design and implementation of cloud automation: Design and implement end-to-end automation solutions using cloud automation tools and technologies. Develop, maintain, and enhance infrastructure as code scripts and templates using tools like Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, or Chef. Create and manage cloud infrastructure resources (AWS, Azure, GCP) using IaC practices. Automate resource provisioning, network configuration, and application deployment processes. ??Providing Technical Expertise: You will be responsible for providing technical expertise to resolve complex issues related to IaC, DevOps services. This includes troubleshooting, identifying the root cause, and implementing solutions. Stay up to date with new cloud services and features and recommend changes to our infrastructure to take advantage of new opportunities. ??Security Management: Ensuring the security of the cloud infrastructure and applications. Implement security best practices in infrastructure code, including access control, encryption, and vulnerability management. Ensure infrastructure complies with industry regulations and internal policies. You should have expertise in implementing and managing security measures in cloud, including implementing security policies, conducting security audits, and managing access control. ??Application Management: Managing the deployment and maintenance of applications on the cloud. This includes monitoring application performance, optimizing resource utilization, and troubleshooting issues related to the application. ??Collaboration and Integration: Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to define and implement a robust DevOps strategy. Working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful delivery of projects and initiatives. Integrate IaC practices into the CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) pipeline to automate the deployment process. Work with version control systems (e.g., Git) to manage infrastructure code and collaborate with team members. ??Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: You will be responsible for documenting procedures and sharing knowledge with other team members. This includes creating technical documentation, conducting training sessions, and providing guidance on best practices. ??Continuous Improvement: Identifying opportunities to improve cloud operations processes and implementing changes to increase efficiency, scalability, and reliability. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities for continuous improvement in cloud infrastructure and processes. This includes proposing and implementing changes to optimize performance, reduce costs, and improve efficiency. Skill profile section: About you This is a customer-facing role and is ideal for an excellent communicator with a positive outlook and having problem solving mindset. You should be ready to work in customer time zone and during off business hours to manage operations. Work experience: Ideally you should have 5+ years relevant experience in large scale Cloud operations, DevOps and Automation, having minimum 12 years of industry experience. Qualifications: ??BE/B.Tech/MCA/ B.Sc. (IT/Computer Science) ??AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer, Google Cloud Professional DevOps Engineer ??Docker Certified Associate, Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) ??HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate/ Red Hat Certified Specialist in Ansible Automation ??ITIL certification Skill profile: ??Technical skills: You should have strong technical skills and expertise in cloud computing and related technologies. o Experience with infrastructure provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Chef and Cloud Formation) and Infrastructure as Code (IAC) approaches. o Experience with large-scale continuous integration systems CI/CD (e.g., Git, GitHub, Gerrit, Jenkins, Artifactory) o Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash, PowerShell, Java, Python, ruby o Experience with Azure DevOps, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Pipelines, ARM templates, Azure Bicep etc. Please share your profiles if interested.

column2: Work Experience:        Between 2-6 years in handling Audio Visual Dealers & Distributors            Qualification:        Graduate/ B.E/ BSC (IT, Computer Science)            Vacant Position:        1        1. Developing and implementing a channel sales strategy: The Channel Sales Manager is responsible for developing and implementing a sales strategy that aligns with the company's goals. This includes identifying potential channel partners, assessing their strengths and weaknesses, and determining how to best leverage them to meet sales targets.    2. Building and maintaining relationships with channel partners: The Channel Sales Manager must develop and maintain strong relationships with channel partners, including distributors, resellers, and VARs. This involves communicating with partners regularly, providing them with the necessary resources and support, and addressing any issues that arise.    3. Managing sales activities: The Channel Sales Manager must track and manage sales activities, including forecasting sales, monitoring performance metrics, and identifying areas for improvement. They may also be responsible for negotiating and closing deals with channel partners.    4. Collaborating with other departments: The Channel Sales Manager must collaborate with other departments, such as marketing and product development, to ensure that the company's channel sales strategy aligns with the overall business strategy.    5. Staying up-to-date with industry trends: The Channel Sales Manager must stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitor activities, and emerging technologies that may impact the company's sales strategy. They may also be responsible for identifying new channels and partners to explore.      To be successful as a Channel Sales Manager, candidates should have strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, as well as a solid understanding of sales principles and techniques. They should also be familiar with the industry and have experience working with channel partners.
